definition: the Silk Road/abbr. for 絲綢之路|丝绸之路[Si1 chou2 zhi1 Lu4]
silk/thread/trace/(cuisine) shreds or julienne strips/CL:條|条[tiao2]/classifier: a thread (of cloud, smoke etc), a bit, an iota, a hint (of sth) etc
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind
surname Lu

sentences.english: The Silk Road Fund was set up to invest in infrastructure abroad.
sentences.chinese: 絲路基金是爲投資海外基礎設施而設立的。

sentences.english: Arthur remained at the gate while Ruth climbed Maria's front steps.
sentences.chinese: 亞瑟留在門日，露絲路上了瑪利亞家門前的臺階。

sentences.english: Fig1. This girl should be a model from New Silk Road Co. in the Big Iron Tower.
sentences.chinese: 這個女孩一定是對面大鐵塔裏新絲路的模特吧。

sentences.english: Over the last decade, the Silk Road Ensemble has performed in 25 countries.
sentences.chinese: 十年來，絲路合奏團已在25個國家舉辦音樂會。

definition: the Silk Road
Yangguan or Southern Pass on the south Silk Road in Gansu, 70 km south of Dunhuang 敦煌
silk cloth/silk
first session (of a conference etc)
the northern part of the country/the North
old tea-horse road or southern Silk Road, dating back to 6th century, from Tibet and Sichuan through Yunnan and Southeast Asia, reaching to Bhutan, Sikkim, India and beyond
entertainment
Jiayu Pass in Gansu, at the western terminus of the Great Wall/Jiayuguan prefecture-level city in Gansu
fire beacon (used as alarm signal over long distance)
Wan Li (1916-2015), PRC politician
Wanli township in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan
far away/thousands of miles/10000 li
Lion city, nickname for Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]
magnificent
foreign country/alien land
south of the five ranges/old term for south China, esp. Guangdong and Guangxi
channel/strait
Huaiji county in Zhaoqing 肇慶|肇庆[Zhao4 qing4], Guangdong
